In the mind of JD Vance, being offered the VP spot was the “most important call of his life.” To his seven-year-old son, it was just another Tuesday and should not take precedence over all things Pokémon.

Vance discussed how he almost missed Trump’s call because his son wouldn't “shut up” about Pokémon cards.

JD Vance tells the @NelkBoys about his 7-year-old son talking to him about Pokémon — as President Trump was aski
title: Watch: JD Vance shares adorable story about phone call between Trump and his seven-year-old son

description:

title: Crowder Closes: A 'Male' Stole Angela Carini's Olympic Dream and Her Promise to Her Late Father

description:
Subscribe to Louder with Crowder on Rumble! Download the app on Apple and Google Play.

One of the worst things about Kamala Harris is that she stands for nothing. She doesn't care who you are or what has to be done, so long as it gets her to the top.

She doesn't care who she has to sleep with, how many illegals have to be let in, or how many races she does or does not identify with, as long as it makes her the most powerful person in the world.

The press tried to walk JD Vance into a corner by using his “three biracial children” to get him to slander Trump as racist. However, this failed given that Harris is a "chameleon".
title: “Kamala Harris is a chameleon:” JD Vance SHUTS DOWN reporter's race-baiting question in epic fashion

The plan for Kamala Harris is clear. Avoid the press until after her speech at the convention. Then hold a "press" "conference." Question one will be how enchanted it is to be the first Black woman running for president. Questions two and three will be lay-ups to attack Donald Trump. We might get a policy question around question five. Then the media will go back claiming anything she said prior to announcing she's running for president doesn't count. Why? title: Watch: These THREE Kamala Harris clips dropped yesterday the media is gonna want to hide from you

title: Watch: Pat McAfee has the stones to speak truth about men competing against women no one else on ESPN does
